title-part.text: WINDOWS, WINDSCREENS, NON-FIXED ROOFS, DOORS, OR SIMILAR DEVICES FOR VEHICLES
REMOVABLE EXTERNAL PROTECTIVE COVERINGS SPECIALLY ADAPTED FOR VEHICLES

reference.text: fastening, suspending, closing, or opening of such devices E05

note.note-paragraph: Windows, windscreens, non-fixed roofs, doors, or similar devices which are of general applicability, irrespective of whether described or claimed only for vehicles, are also classified in subclass E06B.
Attention is drawn to the Note following the title of class B60.
In this subclass non-limiting references (in the sense of paragraph 39 of the Guide to the IPC) may still be displayed in the scheme.

reference.text: B60J10/00 takes precedence; air curtains instead of windows B60J9/04

CPC-specific-text.text: Control means for actuating the roller blind, e.g. using electronic control
powered, e.g. by electric, hydraulic or pneumatic actuators
with screw rods or extensible rods acting on the draw bar for pushing or push-pulling
with flexible actuating elements connected to the draw bar for pulling only, e.g. cords, wires or cables

characterised by the spring motor
characterised by structural elements

Draw bars, including elements attached to it, e.g. sliding shoes, gripping elements or pull cords

Guides
Pivoting arms
Springs for compensating the number of windings of the blind on the tube in case winding tube and draw bar are driven together
Tensioning systems for keeping the blind taut when in use, other than spring motors

of multiple blinds, e.g. more than one blind per window or per actuation system

CPC-specific-text.text: Upper door structure
window frame details, including sash guides and glass runs
Outside rear view mirror support
Inboard or outboard side of window frame formed integrally with the lower door structure
window frame formed separately as module
fastening window frame or parts of window frame to lower door structure
mechanism preventing outward displacement of window frame at high speeds
Beltline
Lower door structure
Inner panel, e.g. characterised by carrying components
Outer panel
Assembly panels to be installed in doors as a module with components, e.g. lock or window lifter, attached thereto
Water or sound barrier, e.g. watershields or seals between dry/wet compartment, sound or vibration dampers
Windows in lower door structures
Reinforcement elements
Elongated type elements, e.g. beams, cables, belts or wires
characterised by position in the lower door structure
the elements being arranged essentially horizontal in the centre of the lower door structure
the elements being arranged at the beltline
the elements being arranged along the lower edge of door
the elements being arranged diagonally
the elements being arranged vertically
the elements being arranged at the hinge area
the elements being arranged at the lock area
the elements being arranged at the handle area
the elements being arranged at the mirror area
characterised by the attachment means to the door, e.g. releasable attachment means
characterised by the type of elongated elements
the elements being flexible, e.g. belts, cables or wires
the elements having a grid-like structure, i.e. interconnected or interwoven elements
Beams
characterised by a special cross section
formed of several elements arranged in series
formed of several elements arranged in parallel
with branched structures
Panel type elements
Block or short strip-type elements
including foams or expanded materials
being expanded onto door panel and forming a laminar structure with door panel, e.g. a rib
integrated in door structure or other door elements, e.g. beam-like shapes stamped in inner door panel
Behaviour during impact
Passive coupling of the reinforcement elements to the door or to the vehicle body
Active coupling of the reinforcement elements to the door or to the vehicle body, e.g. through releasing of pressurized gas
characterised by a pre-defined mode of deformation or displacement in order to absorb impact
the impact being a frontal impact
Conceptual assembling of door, i.e. how door frame parts should be fitted together to form door
using tailored blanks
using cast parts
Fixation or mounting means specific for door components
for door panels, e.g. hemming
characterised by the opening or closing movement
the door having a hinge axis in horizontal direction transverse to vehicle longitudinal axis
the door having a hinge axis in the direction of the vehicle longitudinal axis
due to absence of the B-pillar
convertible doors, e.g. window frame is stored in lower door structure
with two doors opening in opposite direction
without B-pillar or releasable B-pillar, i.e. the pillar is moving with door
characterised by the material
plastic
lightweight metal, e.g. aluminum, magnesium
hybrid, i.e. plastic moulded onto metal parts
Special type
simplified doors related to cabins of, e.g. golf carts, tractors, jeeps, cranes, forklifts, etc.
rectangular of shape, e.g. as found in old fashioned cars and coaches
caravan door
lid, e.g. for luggage compartment accessible at vehicle side

comprising door or part of door being moveable by a linkage system to open/close position

reference.text: covering of load on vehicles B60P7/00; guard strips for body finishing, identifying or decorating B60R13/04; tents for use as garages E04H15/00

note.note-paragraph: In groups B60J11/02 - B60J11/10, the first place priority rule is applied, i.e. at each hierarchical level, in the absence of an indication to the contrary, classification is made in the first appropriate place. This Note corresponds to IPC Note (1) relating to B60J11/02 - B60J11/06.

CPC-specific-text.text: specially adapted for covering vehicle parts, e.g. for doors, windows or windscreens

title-part.text: for covering at least the roof of the vehicle, e.g. for covering the whole vehicle
for covering only specific parts of the vehicle, e.g. for doors

reference.text: covers or guards for traction couplings, hitches, draw-gear or towing devices B60D1/60; guards for wheels, radiators or bumpers B60R19/00
hub caps or the like B60B7/00; external spare wheel stowing, holding or mounting arrangements B62D43/02
